and it was just mind spinning,
because it was an [inaudible] solely

3286.07.text:
for women that was a
building of two floors,

3289.38.text:
many businesses were
started, you had a lady there

3293.38.text:
that started her own
Aude [phonetic] company,

3298.02.text:
in the Middle East,
cologne if you're a guy.

3302.33.text:
Very expensive, I mean these are
very expensive, this lady makes them

3305.95.text:
for royalty and they go from, you
know over a few hundred dollars

3310.33.text:
to a couple of thousand
dollars for a small bottle.

3315.42.text:
Cupcake manufacturers, I
had to run out of there

3317.61.text:
because one was a chocolatier and I
kept eating these things and I said,

3321.36.text:
"I've got to get out of here" , but
these women, they're just amazing.

3325.17.text:
So, the question in Saudi Arabia
now is, "Do we help these women

3329.43.text:
or do we try to get
the women that are

3332.20.text:
in family own businesses are
ready spin out and have operations

3337.76.text:
that are much larger economic
consequence to the Kingdom.

3344.26.text:
So, that's going on, but
they are truly amazing.

3347.27.text: I hope I answered your question.

3381.11.text:
>> Edward Burton: So,
you need to buy my book.

3383.05.text:
Yeas, I spent a good deal of time
talking about technology patenting

3390.00.text:
and interview Mr. Sodus [phonetic]
who runs the national patent office.

3394.09.text:
Spent a number of hours with him and
some of his colleagues and I talked

3397.72.text:
about the evolution of patent,
the patent process in Saudi Arabia

3402.59.text:
and it is improving, I mean it
used to take an incredible amount

3405.97.text:
of time, year and a half, two years
to patent something and longer.

3412.41.text:
Now they have done to months
and they're passionate

3417.34.text:
about bringing efficiency
to the process.

3421.75.text:
A lot of the patents are
coming in from young Saudis,

3429.59.text:
Through the incubators
but they are --

3433.35.text:
the process is discussed
very extensively in my book.

3460.76.text:
it's normally you'll find
universities that have incubators

3464.41.text:
where they take in applications
from Saudis, many of them students

3471.17.text: but they don't have to be.

3473.40.text:
They make these applications to
have access to physical facilities

3477.54.text:
where they make available to these
young entrepreneurs the hardware,

3483.23.text:
the equipment, in many instances
a lot of the soft research

3491.08.text:
and resources that are
available within the institutions

3494.35.text: to help them bring to market --

3501.25.text:
And so, many of the companies,
including one, very famous lady,

3506.25.text:
that made Arabic coffee
maker that is Saudi Arabic

3509.46.text:
that they make an instant
coffee maker is selling --

3520.13.text:
She's -- But those are
examples of technologies

3523.70.text:
and commercialized business products
that came out of incubators.

3528.71.text: The same concept in the west.

3532.61.text:
So, that's one of the misconceptions
of -- maybe deserved 30 --

3547.25.text:
you know 15, 20 years
ago but no so much now.

3550.66.text:
So, the perception is that women,
American women, western women going

3556.64.text:
to Saudi Arabian, can't
get in the country,

3558.62.text:
they can't get visas,
they can't do business.

3561.64.text:
There are certain visa requirements
for instance for married women,

3566.89.text:
you know, you have to certain
information [inaudible] no, no, no,

3570.22.text:
they don't have to be
married, but, you know,

3571.72.text:
on the visa application they
have to basically document

3576.57.text:
that you're married, but when I
was Commercial Attaché for instance

3580.08.text: for 2003 to 2006 I heard that and

3585.79.text:
yet for almost the entire
three years that I was there,

3589.08.text:
almost every month or every other
month we'd see these executives,

3594.47.text:
female executives from American
companies coming in, landing,

3599.73.text:
doing their two to three days'
worth of business and going out

3606.14.text:
and that's only improved
over the years.

3618.76.text:
>> This has been a presentation
of the library of congress.
